active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of using full backups exclusively versus hybrid strategies (full + incremental/differential) in a resource-constrained environment. Consider impacts on storage costs, backup windows, recovery speed, and compliance with NIST SP 800-53. Support arguments with RTO/RPO examples and propose a consensus recommendation.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, and scaffolding. Generate 40 high-quality flashcards on 'Full Backup Methodology' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Business Continuity Planning > Continuity and Recovery Strategies > Data Backup and Protection Strategies > Full Backup Methodology). Use provided research context on full backups, RTO/RPO, NIST CSF/SP 800-53, CIA triad. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste the 6 objectives here] - Scaffolding Layers: Distribute cards evenly (10 per layer) across the 4 layers provided. - Active Learning: Infuse prompts tying to discussion (trade-offs), peer teaching (processes), problem-solving (scenarios). - Bloom's Coverage: Even distribution across levels. - Voter Notes: No consensus; prioritize pedagogy. Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: [ paste schema here ] Output ONLY a JSON array of 40 flashcards: [flashcard1, flashcard2, ...]. Ensure variety: 40% Basic Q&A, 30% Cloze, 20% MCQ (with distractors), 10% Scenario-Apply. Cards must be concise (front <100 words), educational, and exam-ready. Reference sources like NIST where possible.
